title: MLB.com At Bat adds picture-in-picture mobile streaming
text:
Michelle Clancy | 22 September 2015 
MLB.com, owner of the hugely popular baseball channel, has updated its apps At Bat for iPhone and iPad. 
The app, designed, built and distributed by mobile developer MLBAM, has been updated to support the release of iOS 9 and, among other features, now includes picture-in-picture streaming for iPad. 
It marks the first time this functionality – including both live video through MLB.TV and the MLB.TV Game of the Day and the hundreds of on-demand game highlights delivered daily – has been made available on a mobile device. 
MLB.com's At Bat is the top sports mobile app in user consumption, according to comScore. The firm said that At Bat has ranked first in total minutes consumed among all sports mobile apps each month since April. 
The latest comScore monthly rankings, for August, had fan usage of At Bat last month 22% higher than the second place app and 104% higher than the app ranking third. 
At Bat also will be updated with support for watchOS2 when it is made available and will have its annual Post-season update coming later this month.
